title: Coordinator to ensure that research supported by the ESRC initiative represents value for money and achieves impact across the retail sector
abstractText:
The aim of the role is to help to ensure that the research funded through the ESRC Retail sector initiative represents value for money and achieves social, economic and academic impact.

The first objective is to assess and monitor the strategic direction and ‘fit’ of KEO and KTP bids to maximise impact. The second is to identify, design and facilitate appropriate communication and dissemination activities to ensure dialogue, collaboration and synergy between grant-holders and associated stakeholders. The third is to undertake relevant activities to improve research collaboration more broadly between the social science research base and the retail community. 

The aim and objectives will be achieved through:

  • a series of face to face discussions with PIs and project teams to establish the nature and form of support required to enhance impact
  • three Knowledge Sharing Events bringing the cohort together to share experiences and connections with insights from keynote speakers to add value to the projects
  • three Thought Leadership Articles produced after these events for wider dissemination
  • Information Summary Sheets sent to teams which identify relevant developments in the industry and highlight opportunities for knowledge dissemination
  • the development of a web-based communication platform and the formation of a retail advisory network.
